Response.description: The special coating on Dye Sublimation products allow for colourful and photographic designs to be printed, even in small production runs.
For a premium quality product, porcelain is always an excellent choice.
With a more delicate finish than earthenware, bone china products have a more refined feel.

Response.name: Direct
Response.notes: Screen printing. Ideal for bulk printing designs with clearly delineated blocks of colour.

Response.name: Transfer
Response.notes: Transfer printing is ideal for intricate designs with fine detail or tight registration. As the transfers are applied by hand, this process is more labour intensive than direct printing.

Response.name: Dye Sublimation
Response.notes: The Dye Sublimation print process is an excellent option for colourful designs of photographic images. The process is fast and cost-effective for smaller print runs.

Response.name: Digital Printing
Response.notes: Instead of films or screens, high quality CMYK printed images are used. These are cover coated and hand applied as a transfer. This is then fired into the glaze making a durable and lifelong print.

Response.name: Full Colour
Response.notes: Full colour print effect using a four colour transfer for ceramic products, or an in mould labelling process for plastics.
